page.title: 03Mrs Smith's Saturday
page.content: In our family, consisting of 2 adults,2 children and one scruffy dog there is no such thing as a typical Saturday, but the following account is fairly representative. A.M. Up late, parents feeling fragile, searching for first cup of tea. If weather sunny, father out on sit-on lawnmower doing his share of the gardening. Mother left with breakfast dishes and decisions about the rest of the day. Children want to go out. Parents want to stay in. Compromise and go shopping for indispensable items like shoes, seeds, new bicycles, petrol for the lawnmower. Lunch at nearest pub, sitting in garden, or nearest MacDonald's for soggy buns and burgers. P.M. Home, broke but fairly satisfied, whereupon father inspects inside of eyelids on sofa and mother
